newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures mostly up on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures mostly up on short-covering.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended mostly firmer on Friday, as easing concerns over bumper Japan rubber stocks fuelled short-covering, traders said.
Prices were mostly up, except for the March contract which was 0.1 yen per kg lower. Benchmark April ended 0.3 yen higher at 143.2 yen. Activity remained lacklustre.

"Market sentiment has improved after Japan's rubber stocks declined slightly at the end of October," one trader said. "Prices are likely to rise further if the dollar rises against the yen," the trader said.
